SEARCH
Module io.jstach.rainbowgum

Package io.jstach.rainbowgum

@NonNullByDefault package io.jstach.rainbowgum
RainbowGum core components. The flow of log messages is as follows:
  1. RainbowGum
  2. LogRouter
  3. LogPublisher
  4. LogAppender
  5. LogEncoder
  6. LogOutput

  • Class
    Description
    KeyValues
    Key Value Pairs similar to a Map<String,String> but optimized for memory and less garbage (no iterators).
    KeyValues.KeyValuesConsumer<V>
    A specialy consumer that avoids lambda garbage.
    KeyValues.MutableKeyValues
    KeyValues that can be updated.
    LevelResolver
    Resolves levels from logger names.
    LevelResolver.AbstractBuilder<T>
    Abstract level resolver builder.
    LevelResolver.Builder
    Level resolver builder.
    LevelResolver.LevelConfig
    A special resolver that has direct mappings of logger name to level via LevelResolver.LevelConfig.levelOrNull(String).
    LogAppender
    Appenders are guaranteed to be written synchronously much like an actor in actor concurrency.
    LogAppender.AbstractLogAppender
    An abstract appender to help create custom appenders.
    LogAppender.AppenderProvider
    Finds an appender based on URI.
    LogAppender.Builder
    Builder for creating standard appenders.
    LogAppender.ThreadSafeLogAppender
    An appender that can be used by a LogPublisher.SyncLogPublisher.
    LogAppenderRegistry
    Register appenders by name.
    LogConfig
    The configuration of a RainbowGum.
    LogConfig.Builder
    Builder for LogConfig.
    LogConfig.ChangePublisher
    Config Change Publisher.
    LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType
    Changing type options.
    LogConfig.Provider<T>
    A factory that may need config to provide.
    LogEncoder
    Encodes a LogEvent into a buffer of its choosing.
    LogEncoder.AbstractEncoder<T extends LogEncoder.Buffer>
    Abstract encoder that will cast the buffer to the desired implementation.
    LogEncoder.Buffer
    Encoders buffer.
    LogEncoder.Buffer.StringBuilderBuffer
    A buffer that simply wraps a StringBuilder.
    LogEncoder.EncoderProvider
    Finds output based on URI.
    LogEncoderRegistry
    Encoder registry
    LogEvent
    A LogEvent is a container for a single call to a logger.
    LogEvent.Builder
    A builder to create events by calling LogRouter.eventBuilder(String, Level).
    LogEvent.CallerInfo
    Caller info usually derived from Stack walking.
    LogEventLogger
    Logs events.
    LogFormatter
    Formats a log event using a StringBuilder.
    LogFormatter.EventFormatter
    Generic event formatting that is lambda friendly.
    LogFormatter.EventFormatter.Builder
    Log formatter builder that is composed of other formatters.
    LogFormatter.FormatterType
    The types of formatters use for formatter resolving or lookup of formatters designed for specific fields or common uses like literals.
    LogFormatter.KeyValuesFormatter
    Formats key values.
    LogFormatter.LevelFormatter
    Formats a System.Logger.Level.
    LogFormatter.MessageFormatter
    Formats LogEvent.formattedMessage(StringBuilder).
    LogFormatter.NameFormatter
    Formats a logger name.
    LogFormatter.NoopFormatter
    A special formatter that will do nothing.
    LogFormatter.StaticFormatter
    A special formatter that will append static text.
    LogFormatter.ThreadFormatter
    Formats a thread.
    LogFormatter.ThrowableFormatter
    Formats a throwable.
    LogFormatter.TimestampFormatter
    Formats event timestamps.
    LogLifecycle
    A component that has a start and stop.
    LogMessageFormatter
    Formattes a LogEvent message.
    LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter
    Builtin message formatters.
    LogOutput
    A resource that can be written to usually in binary.
    LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput
    Abstract output on outputstream.
    LogOutput.ContentType
    The content type of the binary data passed to the output from an encoder.
    LogOutput.ContentType.StandardContentType
    Builtin content types.
    LogOutput.OutputProvider
    Finds output based on URI.
    LogOutput.OutputType
    Output type useful for defaults and categorization.
    LogOutput.ThreadSafeLogOutput
    Marker interface that the output is thread safe.
    LogOutput.WriteMethod
    The preferred write style of an output.
    LogOutputRegistry
    Register output providers by URI scheme.
    LogProperties
    Provides String based properties like System.getProperty(String) for default configuration of logging levels and output.
    LogProperties.AbstractBuilder<T>
    Abstract log properties builder.
    LogProperties.Builder
    Builder for properties.
    LogProperties.MutableLogProperties
    A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
    LogProperties.MutableLogProperties.Builder
    Mutable Log properties builer.
    LogProperties.Property<T>
    A property description that can retrieve a property result by being passed LogProperties.
    LogProperties.PropertyConvertException
    Thrown if an error happens while converting a property.
    LogProperties.PropertyFunction<T extends @Nullable Object,R extends @Nullable Object,E extends Exception>
    An error friendly Function for converting properties.
    LogProperties.PropertyGetter<T>
    Extracts and converts from LogProperties and is also an immutable builder for LogProperties.Propertys.
    LogProperties.PropertyGetter.ChildPropertyGetter<T>
    Mapped property getter.
    LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RequiredPropertyGetter<T>
    A property getter that guarantees the result will not be missing usually because a non-null fallback is provided somewhere.
    LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RootPropertyGetter
    A property getter and builder that has no conversion but may prefix the key and search recursively up the key path.
    LogProperties.PropertyMissingException
    Throw if property is missing.
    LogProperties.PropertyProblem
    Parent interface for property exceptions.
    LogProperties.RequiredProperty<T>
    A property that should never be missing usually because there is non-null fallback.
    LogProperties.RequiredResult<T>
    A result that is not missing and will either be an error or success.
    LogProperties.Result<T>
    The result of a property fetched from properties.
    LogProperties.Result.Error<T>
    A property that was present but failed conversion.
    LogProperties.Result.Missing<T>
    A property that is missing (null).
    LogProperties.Result.Success<T>
    A property that is present.
    LogProperties.StandardProperties
    Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
    LogPublisher
    Publishers push logs to appenders either synchronously or asynchronously.
    LogPublisher.AbstractBuilder<T>
    Abstract publisher builder.
    LogPublisher.AsyncLogPublisher
    Async publisher.
    LogPublisher.AsyncLogPublisher.Builder
    Async publisher builder.
    LogPublisher.PublisherFactory
    A factory for a publisher from config and appenders.
    LogPublisher.PublisherProvider
    SPI for custom publishers.
    LogPublisher.SyncLogPublisher
    Synchronous publisher.
    LogPublisher.SyncLogPublisher.Builder
    Synchronous publisher builder.
    LogPublisherRegistry
    Registry of publishers
    LogRouter
    Routes messages to a publisher by providing a LogRouter.Route from a logger name and level.
    LogRouter.AbstractRouter
    A user supplied router usually for filtering or transforming purposes.
    LogRouter.RootRouter
    Root router is a router that has child routers.
    LogRouter.Route
    A route is similar to a SLF4J Logger or System Logger but has a much simpler contract.
    LogRouter.Route.Routes
    Route singletons and utilities.
    LogRouter.Router
    Router routes messages to a publisher.
    LogRouter.Router.Builder
    Router builder.
    LogRouter.Router.RouterFactory
    Creates a router.
    PropertiesParser
    Writes and parses properties.
    RainbowGum
    The main entrypoint and configuration of RainbowGum logging.
    RainbowGum.Builder
    RainbowGum Builder.
    ServiceRegistry
    A simple service locator for initialization purposes.
